item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
And the devs thought that the Hazard Course wouldn’t be needed in this age… for the crouch-jumping, they can’t remove that, considering it’s a gameplay mechanic, hence the longjump module or whatever is it called. Removing that would require some drastic Xen changes.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
Because of the hazard course demonstration in HL1, I always thought of the crouch jump as a sort of button-combo mantling system almost, whereas in Black Mesa it was more like “the required key combo to make jumps”

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
Removing it completely would be a mistake, but toning it down so that regular jumps are more, well… regular… That would be a good idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
if the devs remove the crouch jump requirement because of this, I will be disappoint

(I mean, it’s not like this exact same issue was featured in countless threads since BM was released or anything, noooo, this is the first time anyone has ever brought up the issue, yep, no sarcasm at all here)

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: Swaggless
item.description:
Bolteh:

None of you even consider the possibility that he’s just playing a character and does everything wrong on purpose?

Hint: the smack-talk tweets that are scattered across the video.

That video wasn’t uploaded by the guy playing the game, that’s a “look at how dumb this guy is” video upluoaded by someone else highlighting the player guy’s lameness.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: Dotard
item.description:
danielsangeo:

They’ve added a Navi like character that follows you around. “Hay, lissen! You need to crouch jump here.”

Gina Cross’s hologram will appear out of nowhere like a ghost and tell you exactly what to do in case you don’t manage to progress in the game by reaching the next map transition (which shouldn’t be that hard by the way, haha) for like consecutive 5 minutes or so, you heard it here first. Truly next-gen feature.

For the video, it matters not if it isn’t for real, the point of it is to show that indeed real struggles a player may have with the game. After all, picking up a ladder in order to reach a vent is only logical, but can’t be done… seriously, this mod sucks devs, a ladder can’t be climbed up? Uninstalling asap

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
Bolteh:

None of you even consider the possibility that he’s just playing a character and does everything wrong on purpose?

Hint: the smack-talk tweets that are scattered across the video.

Read what I said again. I left that possibility open.

And there is also the possibility that he legitimately played it poorly on a live stream, and then integrated the comments into the YouTube video pointing out how dumb he really is later for the fun of self deprecation.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: Gunsrequiem
item.description:
I laughed hysterically for the first 15 minutes of this video, especially when it speeds up and you hear him going, “What the hell? This is so annoying!” and the like. My girlfriend probably thought I was having a seizure, and I didn’t want to explain because she wouldn’t understand anyway. Thanks for this–watching this during my paper-writing break will hopefully make the rest a lot less painful.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa in a nutshell
item.dc:creator: sourcegamer101
item.description:
Cpl.1nsane:

It’s something that was looked into and ‘fixed’. :freeman:

I hope you used HL2’s jumping mechanics.

The game has the same jump height as current BMS has, however if you jump and press W when trying to jump on something higher than your jump height, Gordon automatically clips to the top of it.

Read full topic
